block.p: Grace Daley, the former Minnesota Lynx guard who was acquired by the Liberty of the W.N.B.A. on Monday, said yesterday that this past season, her rookie year, was no gauge to measure her ability.

''I think part of the system I really didn't fit into,'' Daley said, speaking by telephone from Tulane University in New Orleans. ''You have to find a place where you feel comfortable and your abilities will be challenged, and I didn't find that in Minnesota.''
Grace Daley, the former Minnesota Lynx guard who was acquired by the Liberty of the W.N.B.A. on Monday, said yesterday that this past season, her rookie year, was no gauge to measure her ability.

''I think part of the system I really didn't fit into,'' Daley said, speaking by telephone from Tulane University in New Orleans. ''You have to find a place where you feel comfortable and your abilities will be challenged, and I didn't find that in Minnesota.''

Daley finished her collegiate career as Tulane's leading career scorer, male or female, with 2,249 points. Minnesota made the 5-foot-6 point guard its top draft choice, but she only made made four starts, while averaging 5.8 points, 2.4 rebounds and 1.9 assists in 30 games.
